answers.answer: I am not a physician, but a volunteer and the mom of a type 1 diabetic and the daughter of a type 2.  I can not tell you want is wrong with your daughter, but I can suggest that you do encourage your daughter to get a second, and/or third opinion.  I would also suggest you do try to go to a major medical center.  ( Iknow there are a few in Lousiville)I personally did this when my daughter was diagnosed with diabetes, and a few weeks later I was diagnosed with cancer.  I am lucky that I leave near NYC and had several facilities to choose from. I feel it was the best thing I did as we found a doctor who believes that a child with diabetes is a child firs and a diabetic second which was important to us.  My cancer doctor not only was concerned about my cancer, but the stress in my life for recovery as my daughter was newly diagnosed , s he worked with me and did not have me stay in the hospital long and allowed her to visit me and helped reduce her stress and mine. Were only 5 at the time and diagnosed for a few months).  You need to find a physician you can trust.Good luck, and please check back and let us know how it goes

question: Hi,my daughter has high triglycerides,422.She has all so had a stroke in September.She is only 33 years old.She doesn't eat fatty foods or that much bread.We are all concerned for her.She is having body numbness as well.She loses her balance alot.She starts walking backwards,and can't stop.She has fallen several times.Do you know what might becausing this?She all so has a blood clot on her brain.Her fingers will feel tight,and she says her legs will feel heavy.Her head all so feels heavy,especially when she is laying down,she doesn't like to lay flat,because she says that it is hard for her to get up.The doctors are baffled to what is causing this.We lieve in the state of Kentucky,there are no good doctors around where we lieve at.We are about 100 miles from Louisville.Do you think we need to take my daughter there?She has been having problems since March of this year they have only progressed.She all so has headaches every day.She takes Advil,for them but they don't seem to help.She has all so tried Tylenol.And other over the counter remedies for headaches.Can you please advise me on what to do next.We are at a loss.We are afraid something is going to happen to her.She doesn't feel like her self no more.She is all ways tired and exhausted.Please help us,she has three children.Raven33.
title: daughter has high triglycerides,can this mean diabetes in her future?
